section.name: The Configuration file
section.p: Some global parameters of Eoulsan such as the path of the temporary directory can be set in a configuration file. There are two ways to use a configuration file:

ul.li: use the -conf <file> option of Eoulsan command line. The ~/.eoulsan file will not be read.

section.p: A setting can be also set using the -s option of Eoulsan. See the command line section for more information.
The next table summaries the available parameters of the configuration file:

tr.td: The value of the main.tmp.dir parameter
Path to the temporary directory for binaries extracted from Eoulsan Jar
Path to the working directory (intermediate files of the workflow)
Enable print stack trace when error occurs
Define the user interface to use. There is currently 3 available UI: "basic" (the default UI), "no" (that do nothing) and the experimental "lanterna"
Number of threads to use in local mode
Enable the creation of a PNG image of the workflow

Define the organization of the output files. If value is "flat" all the output files will be in the execution directory, and if value is "step" all the output files of a step will be gethered in a dedicated directory
Define the paths of the formats. Multiple paths can be separated using a space character
Define the paths of the galaxy tools files. Multiple paths can be separated using a space character
If an internet connection is active, add external modules and formats from the eoulsan-tool GitHub repository
The default fastq format: fastq-sanger, fastq-solexa, fastq-illumina or fastq-illumina-1.5
Obfuscate design file when upload to AWS
Remove replicate information in design when upload to AWS
Save step result file in the Eoulsan version 1 format
Enable Rserve server for R computation
Path to the GFF annotations repository
Path to the GTF annotations repository
Path to the additional annotations repository
Path to the genome indexes repository (cannot be an URL)
Path to the genome descriptions repository (cannot be an URL)
Path to the additional annotation hypertext links info file (cannot be an URL)
The Docker library backend to use. Current available backends are: docker-java, spotify, singularity, fallback and default
The Docker server URI. Usually the value is unix:///var/run/docker.sock

If this option is enabled, when mounted data in a Docker container are stored in a NFS volume, mount the root the of NFS volume instead of data path. This option avoid some right issues with NFS root squash
If true, Docker images will be executed using Singularity
Path to the Singularity images directory
Enable send mail to user at the end of analysis
Mail address where send result message
SMTP server to use to send mails. See the SMTP section for more information
ZooKeeper connect String. If not set, the server used will be the same as the job tracker node and the port will the default port set by the zookeeper.default.port
The name of the cluster scheduler to use
The default amount of memory in MB required to launch a step on the cluster
HTCondor concurrency limits values to use if user wants to limit the number of simultaneous running jobs (e.g. eoulsan:2500)
Enable HTCondor "nice user" mode for the submitted jobs
Define accounting group for the submitted jobs

section.p: This values are overridden by the values of the global section of the XML workflow file. Developers can also use additional parameter that are not in the previous table.

subsection.name: SMTP configuration (Mail service)
subsection.p: Eoulsan use the javamail library to send messages to inform user of the end of the analysis. To do this Eoulsan need an SMTP server. If your SMTP server can be used without authentication and with an unencrypted connection on the default port, you just had to set the main.mail.smtp.host parameter in your Eoulsan configuration. Otherwise, you need to add the correct javamail SMTP properties with a "main." prefix to your Eoulsan configuration (e.g. javamail mail.smtp.port property becomes main.mail.smtp.port in Eoulsan configuration).

subsection.name: Eoulsan configuration file sample
subsection.source:
# This is an example of configuration file for Eoulsan. # You need to use the -conf parameter or rename this file to # $HOME/.eoulsan to enable it.
# Temporary directory. # By default Eoulsan use the temporary directory for your platform. main.tmp.dir=/tmp
# Debug mode. # By default in Eoulsan the debug mode is disable. main.debug=false
